content.description:
Lieback to roof then up to 2nd roof, then up a crack to knobs and anchors. You get a lot of bang for your buck on this one.

Named after a chapter in

The Hobbit

.
content.location: Obvious dihedral on left side of east face.

content.description: Long plate climb. It is sort of a traverse (arch) up and left, always staying below the wide chimney gash just above. The leader will need to remember to move up and left, not just up. Bolts and plates will alternate for protection along the way. Work back up to anchors that you rapped from.
content.protection: 6 bolts, pro to 2" (to use in between the plates), and slings.
content.location: From the big ledge (below the summit of Hobbit Dome) rap the south face and descend to the toe of the rock (farthest right). This route starts on the extreme right side of the left-arching flake and then goes diagonally left up the face back up to the anchors.

content.description: A great route, same dihedral start as "Thief in the Night", but avoids the roofs and follows the crack to the summit.
content.location: Dihedral start, then straight up crack instead of off left towards roofs.

content.description: A technical face climb that connects bolts and intermittent water grooves (short cracks).
content.protection: 6 bolts, gear to 2". Small cams helpful.
content.location:
Starts just right of the big overhanging alcove. Bolts and water grooves will lead you up.

Note

: The "Troll's Dihedral"  TR  5.8 follows the left facing flake up to same anchors. (FA Slater & Hayashi 2009)

content.description: Scramble over or rap down to the belay anchors. Then climb some difficult moves up a steep short wall. Great horn to clip anchors from!
content.location: This is the sport route found directly below the summit anchors.
